description: Removal of Condition 6C (Carbon Monitoring) following planning permission 00122/ADJ13-15/P1 dated 04/11/2022 for erection of four residential dwellings with associated landscaping and amenity space
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of planning permission P/2022/1838, dated: 04/11/2022.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: ([Planning Statement], [Design and Access Statement], [Transport Note], [Drainage Assessment Form], [Arboricultural Impact Assessment Report], [Ecological Assessment], [Flood Risk and Surface Water Drainage Assessment ï¿½ Technical Note], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-101000-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-101001-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-110000-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-120000-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-120001-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-120002-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-140000-P1], [3667N-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-300000-P1], Received: 01/06/2022, [Sustainability Report], Received: 17/08/2022, [Construction Logistic Plan], Received: 18/08/2022, [3667N-LB-XX-00-DR-L-130000-P3],    [3667N-LB-XX-00-DR-L-200000-P3], [3667N-LB-XX-00-DR-L-210000-P3], [Unnumbered Proposed 3D-Visuals], Received: 16/09/2022).
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0718, approved on 20/04/2023. 
Reason: In order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and protect living conditions.
Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0546, approved on 05/05/2023. 
 Reason: To ensure that secure cycle spaces are provided and retained for the occupiers of the houses, in accordance with Local Plan Policy EC2 and London Plan Policy T2.
Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0547, approved on 22/03/2023. 

Reason: To ensure that the construction takes place in an acceptable manner and would not cause harm to neighbouring buildings or the wider area.
Condition : 6 - A.	The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved 'Energy Statement' received: 19/05/2022. 
B.	Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
Reason: To ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.
Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.
Condition : 8 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2024/0542, approved on 11/03/2024. 
Reason: In order to ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials.
Condition : 9 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0861, approved on 30/05/2023. 
 Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site.
Condition : 10 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: To ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.
Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted commences:
A.	The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0545, approved on 13/04/2023. 
B.	The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0545, approved on 13/04/2023. 
During the course of the development:
C.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  
Before the development is first brought into use:
D.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. The Local Planning Authority (LPA) therefore wishes to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
A.	An initial phase 1 desk study must be submitted with the original application and will include the aims and objectives, data collection, site reconnaissance (walk over survey), and development of the initial Conceptual Model (CM), which identifies all potential pollutant linkages on the site. The report should also make recommendations for the further gathering of information and or intrusive investigation.  The full site investigation must include intrusive testing for soil and groundwater contamination, soil gasses, and leachate. The investigation shall be carried out at such points and at such depths as the LPA may stipulate. Risk assessments must adhere t
Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2024/0555, approved on 15/04/2024. 
 Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the adjacent the area, to provide satisfactory levels of play equipment and to enhance green infrastructure and biodiversity.
Condition : 13 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the walls of any dwelling hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To protect neighbours' living conditions and to ensure that the accommodation provided is appropriate and respects the character and appearance of the area.
Condition : 14 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out, other than as shown in the approved drawings and, no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:  To protect neighbours' living conditions and the character and appearance of the area and to prevent over-intensive use of the site.
Condition : 15 - The development shall not be occupied until the developer has secured a binding arrangement for the installation on street within 100 metres of the development of two Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW.  Implementation shall be in accordance with details and an installation timetable that shall first have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including a copy of the contract to secure implementation in accordance with that timetable. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications.
Reason: To support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 16 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendation within approved 'Ecological Assessment' received: 01/06/2022. 
Reason: In the interest of biodiversity.
